result.execSummary:
The defendant Deangelo Lamont Bates was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deangelo Lamont Bates

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court ordered defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 0 (zero) days time served.  
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and fees by  June 30, 2016 or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Court ordered restitution payable to Target in the amount of $338.76 by July 30, 2015 or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Filed;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Deangelo Lamont Bates in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Defendant Deangelo Lamont Bates in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Attorney Robert E Webb in court, defendant Deangelo Lamont Bates not in court, in custody at House of Correction on a revocation sentence and not produced.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
Court ordered all conditions to remain in effect.

Attorney Robert E Webb in court, defendant Deangelo Lamont Bates not in court, in custody at MSDF and not produced.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk:  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE. TC. Defense counsel is requesting warrant cancelled. Court ordered warrant cancelled and bail reinstated. Defense counsel requests pre-trial conference.   Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
-To Quash Bench Warrant from Attorney Robert Webb on behalf of his client; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Deangelo Lamont Bates not in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for pre-trial conference.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Target at 3900 N 124th Street

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Deangelo Lamont Bates in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Deangelo Lamont Bates in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dee, Br. 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
